TEXT.English: [TAB]The first cannons evolved in the middle of the 15th century. A predecessor of the cannon was the bombarde. One of the first wars with large scale use of cannons was the "Italian War" of 1494. Cannons were made of bronze in the beginning, but usually made of steel later on. Depending on their targets they could fire different ammunition but usually it was heavy iron bullets. Mobility, fire power and rate of fire were much better than with bombards. In field battles, sieges and battles on sea, the cannon became on of the dominant types of weapons for centuries.
TEXT.French: [TAB]The first cannons evolved in the middle of the 15th century. A predecessor of the cannon was the bombarde. One of the first wars with large scale use of cannons was the "Italian War" of 1494. Cannons were made of bronze in the beginning, but usually made of steel later on. Depending on their targets they could fire different ammunition but usually it was heavy iron bullets. Mobility, fire power and rate of fire were much better than with bombards. In field battles, sieges and battles on sea, the cannon became on of the dominant types of weapons for centuries.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die ersten Kanonen entstanden im mittleren 15. Jahrhundert. Ein Vorgänger der Kanone war die Bombarde. Einer der erste Einsätze von Kanonen im großen Stil war im Jahr 1494, zur Zeit der Italienkriege. Die machmal aus Bronze, gegen später aber meist aus Stahl gegossenen Kanonen, verschossen je nach Einsatz verschiedenste Munition, meist waren es aber Eisenkugeln. In Bezug auf Mobilität, Feuerkraft und Schussrate waren sie Bombarden überlegen. In Feldschlachten, Belagerungsschlachten aber auch bei Schiffsgefechten wurden Kanonen bald für Jahrhunderte eine der dominanten Waffengattungen.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Stonecutters, known throughout history as stone masons or masons for short, are primarily responsible for dressing stone blocks for use in architecture, building and civil engineering. The job of a stonecutter was and continues to be a high skilled profession.
TEXT.French: [TAB]The sheer volume of stone available in the New World made stone carving an extremely simple business. Quarries are generally used for extracting buildings materials. such as dimension stone, construction aggregates, sand and gravel. A skilled Stonecutter could find the better places for stone carving.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das schiere Volumen des in der neuen Welt verfügbaren Steins, macht den Steinabbau zu einem einfachen Geschäft. Im Allgemeinen werden Steinbrüche genutzt um Stein abzubauen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]The sheer volume of stone available in the New World made stone carving an extremely simple business. Quarries are generally used for extracting buildings materials. such as dimension stone, construction aggregates, sand and gravel. A skilled Stonecutter could find the better places for stone carving.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]The sheer volume of stone available in the New World made stone carving an extremely simple business. A skilled Stonecutter could find the better places for stone carving.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Stone has always been and remains one of the most important human building materials. In fact, stone tools predate human history. It appears as if the first stone tools were used by Paranthropus, an ancestor of man who lived about two million years ago. [PARAGRAPH:1]Most stone tools are created by chipping or grinding. The former is used when working with crystalline materials such as flint, chert and obsidian. The worker taps the stone with a harder stone, carefully chipping off stone flakes until the stone has been properly shaped. Mesoamerican tribes used this method to make their sharp and deadly obsidian swords. [PARAGRAPH:1]The grinding method is used when working with harder and coarser materials such as basalt and granite. This is a long and tedious process in which the toolmaker repeatedly grinds away the stone with a harder material or with sand, sometimes using water as a lubricant. Many of the earliest European stone axes were made using this process.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La pierre est depuis toujours le matériau de construction le plus répandu. L'apparition des outils en pierre marque même l'avènement de l'homme. C'est semble-t-il le Paranthropus, un ancêtre de l'homme qui vivait il y a deux millions d'années, qui fut le premier à utiliser des outils en pierre. [PARAGRAPH:1]La plupart des outils en pierre sont fabriqués en taillant ou en polissant la pierre. La première technique est utilisée avec les matériaux cristallins tels que le silex, le chert ou l'obsidienne. Elle consiste à frapper la pierre avec une pierre plus dure pour la tailler progressivement en enlevant des éclats. Les tribus d'Amérique centrale utilisaient cette méthode pour fabriquer leurs épées d'obsidienne. [PARAGRAPH:1]La méthode du polissage est utilisée avec les pierres plus dures, comme le basalte ou le granit. C'est un processus long et laborieux qui consiste à frotter de manière répétée la pierre avec un matériau plus dur ou avec du sable, en l'arrosant parfois pour la lubrifier. Les premières haches de pierre fabriquées en Europe sont nées de ce procédé.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Stein war, ist und bleibt das wichtigste Baumaterial der Menschen. Schon lange vor dem Beginn der Geschichtsschreibung hat es Steinwerkzeuge gegeben. Vermutlich wurden die ersten Steinwerkzeuge vom Paranthropus, einem Urahnen der Menschen, vor etwa zwei Millionen Jahren eingesetzt. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die meisten Steinwerkzeuge werden durch Abschlagen oder Schleifen geschaffen. Erstere Methode wird vor allem bei der Arbeit mit kristallinen Materialien wie Flint, Feuerstein und Obsidian eingesetzt. Der Arbeiter schlägt mit einem härteren Stein auf den Stein, bis dieser die gewünschte Form hat. Mesoamerikanische Stämme nutzten diese Methode, um ihre scharfen und tödlichen Obsidianschwerter herzustellen. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die Schleifmethode wird bei der Arbeit mit härteren Materialien, wie Basalt und Granit, eingesetzt. Bei diesem langen und ermüdenden Prozess schleift der Werkzeugmacher den Stein immer wieder mit einem härteren Material oder mit Sand ab. Manchmal wird dazu auch Wasser als Schmiermittel eingesetzt. Viele der frühen europäischen Steinäxte sind auf diese Art und Weise entstanden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La pietra è da sempre il materiale più importante nelle opere di costruzione dell'uomo. Infatti, i primi oggetti in pietra risalgono agli albori della storia dell'umanità. Pare che fu addirittura il Paronthropus, un antenato dell'uomo vissuto due milioni di anni fa, a utilizzare i primi strumenti realizzati in pietra. [PARAGRAPH:1]La maggior parte degli oggetti in pietra veniva creata scheggiando e affilando: l'artigiano colpiva una pietra con un'altra pietra più dura, cercando di rimuovere piccole scaglie, fino a ottenere la forma desiderata. Le tribù mesoamericane usavano questo metodo per realizzare le loro letali e affilate spade di ossidiana. [PARAGRAPH:1]Il metodo di affilamento veniva utilizzato per lavorare materiali più ruvidi e grezzi, come il basalto e il granito; questo processo era lungo e ripetitivo per l'artigiano, che doveva affilare la pietra con materiale più duro o con sabbia, utilizzando acqua come lubrificante. Molte delle prime asce di pietra europee vennero realizzate con questo procedimento.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La piedra ha sido y sigue siendo uno de los materiales más importantes de construcción de la humanidad. De hecho, las herramientas de piedra pertenecen a la Prehistoria. Parece ser que las primeras fueron empleadas por el parantropus, un antepasado del hombre que vivió hace unos dos millones de años. [PARAGRAPH:1]La mayoría de las herramientas de piedra se creaban a base de cincelar o amolar. La primera técnica se usaba al trabajar materiales cristalinos como el sílex, el pedernal y la obsidiana. El fabricante golpeaba la piedra con otra más dura, separando cuidadosamente escamas de piedra hasta que la herramienta tenía la forma adecuada. Las tribus centroamericanas empleaban este método para fabricar sus afiladas y mortíferas espadas de obsidiana. [PARAGRAPH:1]El método de amolar se empleaba al trabajar con materiales más duros y toscos como el basalto y el granito. Es un proceso largo y tedioso en el que el fabricante desbasta repetidamente la piedra con un material más duro o con arena, empleando a menudo agua como lubricante. Muchas de las primeras hachas de piedra europeas se crearon mediante este proceso.

[PARAGRAPH:1]La maggior parte degli oggetti in pietra veniva creata scheggiando e affilando: l'artigiano colpiva una pietra con un'altra pietra più dura, cercando di rimuovere piccole scaglie, fino a ottenere la forma desiderata. Le tribù mesoamericane usavano questo metodo per realizzare le loro letali e affilate spade di ossidiana. [PARAGRAPH:1]Il metodo di affilamento veniva utilizzato per lavorare materiali più ruvidi e grezzi, come il basalto e il granito; questo processo era lungo e ripetitivo per l'artigiano, che doveva affilare la pietra con materiale più duro o con sabbia, utilizzando acqua come lubrificante. Molte delle prime asce di pietra europee vennero realizzate con questo procedimento.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La piedra ha sido y sigue siendo uno de los materiales más importantes de construcción de la humanidad. De hecho, las herramientas de piedra pertenecen a la Prehistoria. Parece ser que las primeras fueron empleadas por el parantropus, un antepasado del hombre que vivió hace unos dos millones de años. [PARAGRAPH:1]La mayoría de las herramientas de piedra se creaban a base de cincelar o amolar. La primera técnica se usaba al trabajar materiales cristalinos como el sílex, el pedernal y la obsidiana. El fabricante golpeaba la piedra con otra más dura, separando cuidadosamente escamas de piedra hasta que la herramienta tenía la forma adecuada. Las tribus centroamericanas empleaban este método para fabricar sus afiladas y mortíferas espadas de obsidiana. [PARAGRAPH:1]El método de amolar se empleaba al trabajar con materiales más duros y toscos como el basalto y el granito. Es un proceso largo y tedioso en el que el fabricante desbasta repetidamente la piedra con un material más duro o con arena, empleando a menudo agua como lubricante. Muchas de las primeras hachas de piedra europeas se crearon mediante este proceso.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Stone has always been and remains one of the most important human building materials. In fact, stone tools predate human history. It appears as if the first stone tools were used by Paranthropus, an ancestor of man who lived about two million years ago. [PARAGRAPH:1]Most stone tools are created by chipping or grinding. The former is used when working with crystalline materials such as flint, chert and obsidian. The worker taps the stone with a harder stone, carefully chipping off stone flakes until the stone has been properly shaped. Mesoamerican tribes used this method to make their sharp and deadly obsidian swords. [PARAGRAPH:1]The grinding method is used when working with harder and coarser materials such as basalt and granite. This is a long and tedious process in which the toolmaker repeatedly grinds away the stone with a harder material or with sand, sometimes using water as a lubricant. Many of the earliest European stone axes were made using this process.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La pierre est depuis toujours le matériau de construction le plus répandu. L'apparition des outils en pierre marque même l'avènement de l'homme. C'est semble-t-il le Paranthropus, un ancêtre de l'homme qui vivait il y a deux millions d'années, qui fut le premier à utiliser des outils en pierre. [PARAGRAPH:1]La plupart des outils en pierre sont fabriqués en taillant ou en polissant la pierre. La première technique est utilisée avec les matériaux cristallins tels que le silex, le chert ou l'obsidienne. Elle consiste à frapper la pierre avec une pierre plus dure pour la tailler progressivement en enlevant des éclats. Les tribus d'Amérique centrale utilisaient cette méthode pour fabriquer leurs épées d'obsidienne. [PARAGRAPH:1]La méthode du polissage est utilisée avec les pierres plus dures, comme le basalte ou le granit. C'est un processus long et laborieux qui consiste à frotter de manière répétée la pierre avec un matériau plus dur ou avec du sable, en l'arrosant parfois pour la lubrifier. Les premières haches de pierre fabriquées en Europe sont nées de ce procédé.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Stein war, ist und bleibt das wichtigste Baumaterial der Menschen. Schon lange vor dem Beginn der Geschichtsschreibung hat es Steinwerkzeuge gegeben. Vermutlich wurden die ersten Steinwerkzeuge vom Paranthropus, einem Urahnen der Menschen, vor etwa zwei Millionen Jahren eingesetzt. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die meisten Steinwerkzeuge werden durch Abschlagen oder Schleifen geschaffen. Erstere Methode wird vor allem bei der Arbeit mit kristallinen Materialien wie Flint, Feuerstein und Obsidian eingesetzt. Der Arbeiter schlägt mit einem härteren Stein auf den Stein, bis dieser die gewünschte Form hat. Mesoamerikanische Stämme nutzten diese Methode, um ihre scharfen und tödlichen Obsidianschwerter herzustellen. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die Schleifmethode wird bei der Arbeit mit härteren Materialien, wie Basalt und Granit, eingesetzt. Bei diesem langen und ermüdenden Prozess schleift der Werkzeugmacher den Stein immer wieder mit einem härteren Material oder mit Sand ab. Manchmal wird dazu auch Wasser als Schmiermittel eingesetzt. Viele der frühen europäischen Steinäxte sind auf diese Art und Weise entstanden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La pietra è da sempre il materiale più importante nelle opere di costruzione dell'uomo. Infatti, i primi oggetti in pietra risalgono agli albori della storia dell'umanità. Pare che fu addirittura il Paronthropus, un antenato dell'uomo vissuto due milioni di anni fa, a utilizzare i primi strumenti realizzati in pietra. [PARAGRAPH:1]La maggior parte degli oggetti in pietra veniva creata scheggiando e affilando: l'artigiano colpiva una pietra con un'altra pietra più dura, cercando di rimuovere piccole scaglie, fino a ottenere la forma desiderata. Le tribù mesoamericane usavano questo metodo per realizzare le loro letali e affilate spade di ossidiana. [PARAGRAPH:1]Il metodo di affilamento veniva utilizzato per lavorare materiali più ruvidi e grezzi, come il basalto e il granito; questo processo era lungo e ripetitivo per l'artigiano, che doveva affilare la pietra con materiale più duro o con sabbia, utilizzando acqua come lubrificante. Molte delle prime asce di pietra europee vennero realizzate con questo procedimento.

Parece ser que las primeras fueron empleadas por el parantropus, un antepasado del hombre que vivió hace unos dos millones de años. [PARAGRAPH:1]La mayoría de las herramientas de piedra se creaban a base de cincelar o amolar. La primera técnica se usaba al trabajar materiales cristalinos como el sílex, el pedernal y la obsidiana. [PARAGRAPH:1]El método de amolar se empleaba al trabajar con materiales más duros y toscos como el basalto y el granito. Muchas de las primeras hachas de piedra europeas se crearon mediante este proceso.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Relatively early in the times of the colonization of the New World Sheep were brought to the wide plains. Although not all areas were fit for sheep herding becaues of lack of water or diseases the production of Wool also became an important industry. Although never as important as Cattle, Sheep still had an important impact on the industry of the New World.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Relatively early in the times of the colonization of the New World Sheep were brought to the wide plains. Although not all areas were fit for sheep herding becaues of lack of water or diseases the production of Wool also became an important industry. Although never as important as Cattle, Sheep still had an important impact on the industry of the New World.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Sehr früh in der Kolonisierung der Neuen Welt wurde Nutzvieh aus Europa eingeführt, darunter auch Schafe. Obwohl Schafe und die damit verbundene Produktion von Wolle und Kleidung nie so bedeutend waren, wie die Rinderzucht, wurden sie dennoch ein wichtiger Industriezweig. Eine große Anzahl an Schafshirten war bald in diesem Industriezweig beschäftigt. Die Gegenden in denen Veihzucht möglich war, waren bald sehr begeehrt, was auch zu vielen Konflikten zwischen Rinderzüchtern und Schafzüchtern, wie auch mit den Ureinwohern, führte. Riesige Schafranches entstanden.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Relatively early in the times of the colonization of the New World Cattle was brought to the wide plains. Although not all areas were fit for cattle herding becaues of lack of water or diseases the production of Leathergoods from Hides soon became a very important industry.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Relatively early in the times of the colonization of the New World Cattle was brought to the wide plains. Although not all areas were fit for cattle herding becaues of lack of water or diseases the production of Leathergoods from Hides soon became a very important industry.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Sehr früh in der Kolonisierung der Neuen Welt wurden Rinder aus Europa eingeführt. Obwohl es auch viele Gegenden gab, in denen Rinderzucht aufgrund von Wassermangel oder Krankheiten nicht möglich war, wurde die Rinderzucht und der Verkauf von Lederwaren in die Alte Welt schnell zu einem sehr wichtigen Industriezweig. Eine große Anzahl an Rinderhirten, den Cowboys, war bald in diesem Industriezweig beschäftigt. Die Gegenden in denen Rinderzucht möglich war, waren bald sehr begeehrt, was auch zu vielen Konflikten mit den Ureinwohern führte. Riesige Rinderranches entstanden.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Butchers are an ancient trade group who profession is probably as old as the domestication of livestock. In England Butchers first formed guilds as early as 1272. Traditionally butchers used to perform the tasks of slaughtering animals and dressing their flesh as well as selling the meat. In modern times butchers may still be responsible for a combination of these tasks, though typically perform only the last.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Butchery is a traditional work. Slaughterhouses use butchers to slaughter the animals, performing one or a few of the steps repeatedly as specialists on a organized and work divided disassembly line. The steps include stunning (rendering the animal incapacitated), exsanguination (severing the carotid or brachial arteries to facilitate blood removal), skinning (removing the hide or pelt) or scalding and dehairing (pork), evisceration (removing the viscera) and splitting (dividing the carcass in half longitudinally).
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Fleischer, auch Metzger, Schlachter ist einer der älteren Handwerksberufe. Fleischer beschäftigen sich mit der Schlachtung und mit der Herstellung von Fleisch- und Wurstwaren, sie arbeiten in Schlachthöfen und in Fleischereien.

TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Butchery is a traditional work. Slaughterhouses use butchers to slaughter the animals, performing one or a few of the steps repeatedly as specialists on a organized and work divided disassembly line. The steps include stunning (rendering the animal incapacitated), exsanguination (severing the carotid or brachial arteries to facilitate blood removal), skinning (removing the hide or pelt) or scalding and dehairing (pork), evisceration (removing the viscera) and splitting (dividing the carcass in half longitudinally).
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Butchery is a traditional work. Slaughterhouses use butchers to slaughter the animals, performing one or a few of the steps repeatedly as specialists on a organized and work divided disassembly line. The steps include stunning (rendering the animal incapacitated), exsanguination (severing the carotid or brachial arteries to facilitate blood removal), skinning (removing the hide or pelt) or scalding and dehairing (pork), evisceration (removing the viscera) and splitting (dividing the carcass in half longitudinally).

TEXT.English: [TAB]Dyeing is the process of applying colors to fabrics. A human practice for over three thousand years, it enabled the natural white color of silk, wool and cotton to be enhanced with a varied spectrum of color. Natural dyes are created from a myriad of sources, including shells, animals and plants, though these dyes were not always permanent and frequently expensive. Modern dyes are based on artificial or processed substances such as coal and other chemicals. One benefit for a nation with an extensive dye industry is that the processes involved in creating dye can be easily retooled to other purposes. Germany discovered this in World War I when it was determined that factories producing artificial dye could be easily modified to create explosives, poison gas and other tools of war.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La teinture est le procédé de coloration des tissus. Cette pratique, vieille de plus trois mille ans, permet de donner de la couleur aux textiles blancs comme la soie, le coton ou la laine. Les teintures naturelles sont obtenues de multiples façons, que ce soit à partir de coquillages, de plantes ou d'animaux. Mais ces teintures ne sont pas toujours permanentes et sont souvent chères. Les colorants modernes sont à base de produits synthétiques ou traités, comme le charbon ou divers produits chimiques. Un pays possédant une industrie des teintures florissante peut facilement adapter les procédés de fabrication des teintures à d'autres fins. L'Allemagne a ainsi découvert au cours de la Première Guerre mondiale que les usines de fabrication de colorants artificiels pouvaient aisément être transformées pour créer des explosifs, des poisons ou autres instruments de guerre.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das Färben von Stoffen und Fasern gehört schon seit mehr als drei Jahrtausenden zu den vom Menschen praktizierten Handwerken. Durch das Eintauchen der Materialien in Farbe ließ sich das natürliche Weiß von Seide, Wolle und Baumwolle in verschiedene Farbnuancen einfärben. Natürliche Färbemittel wurden aus unzähligen Quellen, einschließlich Muscheln, Tieren und Pflanzen, gewonnen, obwohl diese nicht immer dauerhaft und meist auch teuer waren. Moderne Färbemittel basieren auf künstlichen oder verarbeiteten Substanzen wie Kohle und anderen Chemikalien. Ein Land mit einer ausgedehnten Färbeindustrie hat den Vorteil, dass die zur Herstellung von Färbemitteln notwendigen Verfahren leicht für andere Zwecke abgewandelt werden können. Während des 1. Weltkrieges zeigte es sich in Deutschland, dass Fabriken, in denen künstliche Färbemittel hergestellt wurden, kurzerhand so umstrukturiert werden konnten, dass sie stattdessen Sprengstoffe, giftiges Gas und anderes Kriegsmaterial produzierten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La colorazione è il processo di applicazione dei colori ai tessuti. Si tratta di una pratica dell'uomo utilizzata da oltre tremila anni, che consente vari tipi di modifica del colore bianco naturale della seta, della lana e del cotone. La tinta naturale è creata da numerosissime fonti, comprese le conchiglie, gli animali e le piante, malgrado questi non siano sempre disponibili e risultino spesso costosi. La tinta moderna si basa su sostanze artificiali o lavorate, come il carbone e altri elementi chimici; una nazione con una solida industria in questo campo beneficia del fatto che i processi implicati nella creazione della tinta possano essere trasformati agevolmente per altri scopi. La Germania ha effettuato questa scoperta durante la Prima Guerra Mondiale, rendendosi conto che le fabbriche di produzione della tinta artificiale potevano essere facilmente modificate per creare esplosivi e altri strumenti bellici.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El tinte es el proceso de aplicar colores a los tejidos. Una práctica humana que, durante más de tres mil años, permitía ampliar el blanco natural de la seda, la lana y el algodón a todo un espectro de colores. Los tintes naturales se crean a partir de miles de sustancias, incluyendo conchas, animales y plantas, aunque estos tintes son frecuentemente caros y no siempre permanentes. Los tintes modernos se basan en sustancias artificiales o procesadas, como el carbón vegetal y otros compuestos químicos. Las naciones que poseen grandes industrias de teñido tienen la ventaja de que los procesos para la creación del tinte se pueden reconvertir fácilmente en otros. Alemania lo descubrió en la Primera Guerra Mundial, cuando se comprobó que las fábricas de tinte artificial podían modificarse fácilmente para fabricar explosivos, gas venenoso y otras herramientas bélicas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Relatively early in the times of the colonization of the New World Sheep were brought to the wide plains. Although not all areas were fit for sheep herding becaues of lack of water or diseases the production of Wool also became an important industry. Although never as important as Cattle, Sheep still had an important impact on the industry of the New World.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Relatively early in the times of the colonization of the New World Sheep were brought to the wide plains. Although not all areas were fit for sheep herding becaues of lack of water or diseases the production of Wool also became an important industry. Although never as important as Cattle, Sheep still had an important impact on the industry of the New World.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Sehr früh in der Kolonisierung der Neuen Welt wurde Nutzvieh aus Europa eingeführt, darunter auch Schafe. Obwohl Schafe und die damit verbundene Produktion von Wolle und Kleidung nie so bedeutend waren, wie die Rinderzucht, wurden sie dennoch ein wichtiger Industriezweig. Eine große Anzahl an Schafshirten war bald in diesem Industriezweig beschäftigt. Die Gegenden in denen Veihzucht möglich war, waren bald sehr begeehrt, was auch zu vielen Konflikten zwischen Rinderzüchtern und Schafzüchtern, wie auch mit den Ureinwohern, führte. Riesige Schafranches entstanden.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Relatively early in the times of the colonization of the New World Cattle was brought to the wide plains. Although not all areas were fit for cattle herding becaues of lack of water or diseases the production of Leathergoods from Hides soon became a very important industry.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Relatively early in the times of the colonization of the New World Cattle was brought to the wide plains. Although not all areas were fit for cattle herding becaues of lack of water or diseases the production of Leathergoods from Hides soon became a very important industry.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Sehr früh in der Kolonisierung der Neuen Welt wurden Rinder aus Europa eingeführt. Obwohl es auch viele Gegenden gab, in denen Rinderzucht aufgrund von Wassermangel oder Krankheiten nicht möglich war, wurde die Rinderzucht und der Verkauf von Lederwaren in die Alte Welt schnell zu einem sehr wichtigen Industriezweig. Eine große Anzahl an Rinderhirten, den Cowboys, war bald in diesem Industriezweig beschäftigt. Die Gegenden in denen Rinderzucht möglich war, waren bald sehr begeehrt, was auch zu vielen Konflikten mit den Ureinwohern führte. Riesige Rinderranches entstanden.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Wool Clothes have been one of the most important methods of clothing in human history for thousands of years. During colonization of the New World Sheep had been brought to the colonies and thus Wool Clothes had become quite common.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Wool Clothes have been one of the most important methods of clothing in human history for thousands of years. During colonization of the New World Sheep had been brought to the colonies and thus Wool Clothes had become quite common..
TEXT.German: [TAB]Wollkleidung war über Jahrtausende eine der wichtigsten Kleidungsarten in der alten Welt. Während der Kolonisation wurden grössere Mengen an Schafen in die Neue Welt gebracht und dort gezüchtet, wodurch Wollkleidung auch dort üblich wurde.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Leather is a durable and flexible material created by the tanning of animal rawhide and skin, often cattle hide. It can be produced through manufacturing processes ranging from cottage industry to heavy industry. Tanning is the process which matches the protein of the raw hide or skin into a stable material which will not putrefy and is suitable for a wide variety of end applications. The principal difference between raw hides and tanned hides is that raw hides dry out to form a hard inflexible material that when re-wetted or wetted back putrefy, while tanned material dries out to a flexible form that does not become putrid when wetted back.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Leather is a durable and flexible material created by the tanning of animal rawhide and skin, often cattle hide. It can be produced through manufacturing processes ranging from cottage industry to heavy industry. Tanning is the process which matches the protein of the raw hide or skin into a stable material which will not putrefy and is suitable for a wide variety of end applications. The principal difference between raw hides and tanned hides is that raw hides dry out to form a hard inflexible material that when re-wetted or wetted back putrefy, while tanned material dries out to a flexible form that does not become putrid when wetted back.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Leder war in der menschlichen Geschichte eines der wichtigsten Materialien. Meist aus Rinderhäuten hergestellt diente Leder verschiedensten Zwecken, meist jedoch der Herstellung von Kleidung. Ledergerber war zwar einer der am weningsten angesehenen Berufe oder Stände, aber essentiell für jede damalige Gesellschaft. Auch in der neuen Welt spielte die Herstellung von Leder eine bedeutende Rolle.

TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Leather is a durable and flexible material created by the tanning of animal rawhide and skin, often cattle hide. It can be produced through manufacturing processes ranging from cottage industry to heavy industry. Tanning is the process which matches the protein of the raw hide or skin into a stable material which will not putrefy and is suitable for a wide variety of end applications. The principal difference between raw hides and tanned hides is that raw hides dry out to form a hard inflexible material that when re-wetted or wetted back putrefy, while tanned material dries out to a flexible form that does not become putrid when wetted back.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Tanning is the process of treating skins of animals to produce leather. Skins arrived at the tannery typically dried stiff. Tanners would soak the skins to soften them, then pound and scour the skins to remove any flesh and fat. To remove fur fibers in the skin the tanner would soak the skin in either urine, lime or allow it to putrefy. With the hair removed the tanner would coat the skin in dung until they became supple but not too soft. Tanners understandably were often located on the outskirts of town due to the unpleasant smells that tanneries produced.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Leather has been one of the most important goods in human history. Usually procuced from Hides of Cattle it is mostly used for production of clothes.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Leder war in der menschlichen Geschichte eines der wichtigsten Materialien. Meist aus Rinderhäuten hergestellt diente Leder verschiedensten Zwecken, meist jedoch der Herstellung von Kleidung. Ledergerber war zwar einer der am weningsten angesehenen Berufe oder Stände, aber essentiell für jede damalige Gesellschaft. Auch in der neuen Welt spielte die Herstellung von Leder eine bedeutende Rolle.

TEXT.German: [TAB]Gerben bezeichnet die Verarbeitung von rohen Tierhäuten zu Leder. In einer Gerberei beziehungsweise Lederfabrik wird durch den Einsatz von Gerbstoffen das Hautgefüge stabilisiert und damit Leder hergestellt. Es gibt unterschiedlichste Verfahren zur Gerbung. Früher waren diese jedoch meist mit sehr unangenehmen Gerüchen verbunden, sodass Gerberei-Betriebe meist nur am Stadtrand geduldet wurden.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Edible salt is a mineral, one of the few rocks humans eat. Salt is necessary for the survival of all living creatures, including humans. Salt is involved in regulating the water content (fluid balance) of the body. Salt flavor is one of the basic tastes. In the past, salt was difficult to obtain, but had a great importance in food preservation and as a vital food additive. Therefore, it was a highly valued trade item throughout history. Wars were fought over it; states were formed and destroyed because of it. Roman soldiers were partially paid with salt, and this is still evident in the English language as the word salary derives from the Latin word salarium that means payment in salt (Latin sal), as well as the phrase "worth one's salt". It was also of high value to the Hebrews, Greeks and other peoples of antiquity. During the late Roman Empire and throughout the Middle Ages salt was a precious commodity carried along the salt roads into the heartland of the Germanic tribes. Cities, states and dukedoms along the salt roads exacted heavy duties and taxes for the salt passing through their territories. This practice caused wars, it even caused the formation of cities such as the city of Munich in 1158 when the then Duke of Bavaria Henry XII, called The Lion, decided that the bishops of Freising no longer needed their salt revenue. - Wikipedia
TEXT.French: [TAB]Edible salt is a mineral, one of the few rocks humans eat. Salt is necessary for the survival of all living creatures, including humans. Salt is involved in regulating the water content (fluid balance) of the body. Salt flavor is one of the basic tastes. In the past, salt was difficult to obtain, but had a great importance in food preservation and as a vital food additive. Therefore, it was a highly valued trade item throughout history. Wars were fought over it; states were formed and destroyed because of it. Roman soldiers were partially paid with salt, and this is still evident in the English language as the word salary derives from the Latin word salarium that means payment in salt (Latin sal), as well as the phrase "worth one's salt". This practice caused wars, it even caused the formation of cities such as the city of Munich in 1158 when the then Duke of Bavaria Henry XII, called The Lion, decided that the bishops of Freising no longer needed their salt revenue. - Wikipedia
TEXT.German: [TAB]Salz zählt von altersher und überall in der Welt zu den begehrtesten Gewürzen. Viele traditionelle Fleisch- und Milchspeisen können ohne Salz nicht zubereitet werden. In Südamerika wurde Salz häufig durch das Auswaschen, Filtern und Einkochen salziger Erde gewonnen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il sale e anzitutto un esaltatore di sapidita usato in tutte le tradizioni culinarie conosciute ed e ampiamente sfruttato nell'industria conserviera sia come ingrediente che come mezzo di conservazione dei cibi. Quest'ultima proprieta e dovuta all'effetto disidratante che il sale ha sui materiali con cui viene a contatto, da cui estrae l'acqua per osmosi. Sale da cucina additivato di elementi particolari puo essere prescritto per curare o prevenire alcune malattie (ad esempio il sale iodato per il gozzo o addizionato di cloruro di potassio per l'ipertensione). Il sale e anche un reagente usato in chimica, ad esempio per migliorare la precipitazione dei prodotti al termine di una saponificazione. Un uso importante nell'industria chimica e come materia prima negli impianti cloro-soda, in cui viene eseguita l'elettrolisi della salamoia di cloruro di sodio per ottenere cloro gassoso, idrogeno e soda caustica, tutte materie prime fondamentali per l'industria chimica. Il sale trova impiego anche come anti-gelo: sparso sulle superfici ghiacciate, ne provoca lo scioglimento, dato che una miscela di ghiaccio e sale forma un eutettico il cui punto di fusione e inferiore ai meno 10 gradi celsius. - Wikipedia
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La sal se puede emplear en la alimentacion con dos objetivos diferentes, por un lado su capacidad de realzar ciertos sabores hace que sea un condimento muy habitual, por otro lado su capacidad de conservar alimentos hace que sea adecuado para la elaboracion de salazones y encurtidos. Se puede decir que el uso de la sal en la alimentacion se centra en estas dos actividades. Muchos de los alimentos poseen una etimologias que recuerdan a la sal como uno de los ingredientes base, ejemplos de ello son: las ensaladas, las salchichas (proveniente del latin salsus: en sal) y las salsas, el salmorejo, etc. El uso de sal en las elaboraciones de ciertos alimentos ha ido descendiendo desde el siglo XVIII, esta afirmacion puede comprobarse en los libros de recetas en los que puede verse un uso 'excesivo' de sal para los gustos de hoy en dia. Se han realizado investigaciones acerca del consumo de sal en los humanos occidentales, y se ha podido comprobar que el 10% de la sal que se ingiere proviene de forma natural de los alimentos, el 15% proviene de lo que se anade durante la elaboraccion casera de los alimentos y el 75% proviene de lo que anaden las industrias alimentarias en el procesado de los alimentos. Estos estudios muestran que un britanico medio a finales del siglo XX consumia cerca de 10 gramos de sal (en mas detalle 10.7 gramos de sal en un varon y 8.0 gramos para las mujeres). Estos datos indican que una dieta baja en sal debe regularse principalmente en la compra de los productos ademas de reducir su cantidad durante el cocinado. Esta probado que las dietas bajas en sal son pobres en sabores, pudiendo afectar incluso a los aromas. La sal al ser consumida induce a provocar un mayor apetito por los alimentos, este efecto es aprovechado a veces por la industria de alimentacion e incluye a veces un alto contenido de sal en los alimentos con el objeto de que se consuma mas. De todas formas la sal posee ventajas en el procesado de alimentos: resulta barata, potencia sabores, elimina sabores acidos, extiende la vida de los alimentos, hace que pesen mas ya que retiene humedad. Algunos autores han investigado la preferencia animal por la sal desde un fundamento endocrino Uno de los sistemas hormonales para la regulacion del sodio en el cuerpo es angiotensina, se ha demostrado que esta hormona es capaz de regular la sensacion de sed, se sabe que esta hormona puede tener influencia en la preferencia psicologica por la sal. Existen casos investigados en los que un tratamiento hormonal (mediante la adrenomedulina denominada ADM) puede llegar a reducir el apetito por la sal. El apetito innato de los animales (incluido el hombre) por la sal ha despertado numerosas investigaciones acerca del efecto y preferencias por el sabor salado, parece ser que los recien nacidos no parecen distinguir el sabor salado y no es hasta pasados cuatro meses desde su nacimiento cuando empiezan a distinguirlo. De la misma forma se sabe la dependencia de la sal disminuye si se disminuye su consumo, este efecto de dependencia dura solo un par de semanas y posteriormente las personas se acostumbran a una dieta baja en sales. El apetito por la sal puede tener una dependencia climatica, por ejemplo, las personas que viven en climas frios pueden tener en sus gastronomias locales una presencia mayor por los alimentos con fuerte sabor salado. - Wikipedia

Sale da cucina additivato di elementi particolari puo essere prescritto per curare o prevenire alcune malattie (ad esempio il sale iodato per il gozzo o addizionato di cloruro di potassio per l'ipertensione). Il sale e anche un reagente usato in chimica, ad esempio per migliorare la precipitazione dei prodotti al termine di una saponificazione. Un uso importante nell'industria chimica e come materia prima negli impianti cloro-soda, in cui viene eseguita l'elettrolisi della salamoia di cloruro di sodio per ottenere cloro gassoso, idrogeno e soda caustica, tutte materie prime fondamentali per l'industria chimica. Il sale trova impiego anche come anti-gelo: sparso sulle superfici ghiacciate, ne provoca lo scioglimento, dato che una miscela di ghiaccio e sale forma un eutettico il cui punto di fusione e inferiore ai meno 10 gradi celsius. - Wikipedia
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La sal se puede emplear en la alimentacion con dos objetivos diferentes, por un lado su capacidad de realzar ciertos sabores hace que sea un condimento muy habitual, por otro lado su capacidad de conservar alimentos hace que sea adecuado para la elaboracion de salazones y encurtidos. Se puede decir que el uso de la sal en la alimentacion se centra en estas dos actividades. Muchos de los alimentos poseen una etimologias que recuerdan a la sal como uno de los ingredientes base, ejemplos de ello son: las ensaladas, las salchichas (proveniente del latin salsus: en sal) y las salsas, el salmorejo, etc. El uso de sal en las elaboraciones de ciertos alimentos ha ido descendiendo desde el siglo XVIII, esta afirmacion puede comprobarse en los libros de recetas en los que puede verse un uso 'excesivo' de sal para los gustos de hoy en dia. Se han realizado investigaciones acerca del consumo de sal en los humanos occidentales, y se ha podido comprobar que el 10% de la sal que se ingiere proviene de forma natural de los alimentos, el 15% proviene de lo que se anade durante la elaboraccion casera de los alimentos y el 75% proviene de lo que anaden las industrias alimentarias en el procesado de los alimentos. Estos estudios muestran que un britanico medio a finales del siglo XX consumia cerca de 10 gramos de sal (en mas detalle 10.7 gramos de sal en un varon y 8.0 gramos para las mujeres). Estos datos indican que una dieta baja en sal debe regularse principalmente en la compra de los productos ademas de reducir su cantidad durante el cocinado. Esta probado que las dietas bajas en sal son pobres en sabores, pudiendo afectar incluso a los aromas. La sal al ser consumida induce a provocar un mayor apetito por los alimentos, este efecto es aprovechado a veces por la industria de alimentacion e incluye a veces un alto contenido de sal en los alimentos con el objeto de que se consuma mas. De todas formas la sal posee ventajas en el procesado de alimentos: resulta barata, potencia sabores, elimina sabores acidos, extiende la vida de los alimentos, hace que pesen mas ya que retiene humedad. Algunos autores han investigado la preferencia animal por la sal desde un fundamento endocrino Uno de los sistemas hormonales para la regulacion del sodio en el cuerpo es angiotensina, se ha demostrado que esta hormona es capaz de regular la sensacion de sed, se sabe que esta hormona puede tener influencia en la preferencia psicologica por la sal. Existen casos investigados en los que un tratamiento hormonal (mediante la adrenomedulina denominada ADM) puede llegar a reducir el apetito por la sal. El apetito innato de los animales (incluido el hombre) por la sal ha despertado numerosas investigaciones acerca del efecto y preferencias por el sabor salado, parece ser que los recien nacidos no parecen distinguir el sabor salado y no es hasta pasados cuatro meses desde su nacimiento cuando empiezan a distinguirlo. De la misma forma se sabe la dependencia de la sal disminuye si se disminuye su consumo, este efecto de dependencia dura solo un par de semanas y posteriormente las personas se acostumbran a una dieta baja en sales. El apetito por la sal puede tener una dependencia climatica, por ejemplo, las personas que viven en climas frios pueden tener en sus gastronomias locales una presencia mayor por los alimentos con fuerte sabor salado. - Wikipedia

TEXT.English: [TAB]Edible salt is a mineral, one of the few rocks humans eat. Salt is necessary for the survival of all living creatures, including humans. Salt is involved in regulating the water content (fluid balance) of the body. Salt flavor is one of the basic tastes. In the past, salt was difficult to obtain, but had a great importance in food preservation and as a vital food additive. Therefore, it was a highly valued trade item throughout history. Wars were fought over it; states were formed and destroyed because of it. Roman soldiers were partially paid with salt, and this is still evident in the English language as the word salary derives from the Latin word salarium that means payment in salt (Latin sal), as well as the phrase "worth one's salt". It was also of high value to the Hebrews, Greeks and other peoples of antiquity. During the late Roman Empire and throughout the Middle Ages salt was a precious commodity carried along the salt roads into the heartland of the Germanic tribes. Cities, states and dukedoms along the salt roads exacted heavy duties and taxes for the salt passing through their territories. This practice caused wars, it even caused the formation of cities such as the city of Munich in 1158 when the then Duke of Bavaria Henry XII, called The Lion, decided that the bishops of Freising no longer needed their salt revenue. - Wikipedia
TEXT.French: [TAB]Edible salt is a mineral, one of the few rocks humans eat. Salt is necessary for the survival of all living creatures, including humans. Salt is involved in regulating the water content (fluid balance) of the body. Salt flavor is one of the basic tastes. In the past, salt was difficult to obtain, but had a great importance in food preservation and as a vital food additive. Therefore, it was a highly valued trade item throughout history. Wars were fought over it; states were formed and destroyed because of it. Roman soldiers were partially paid with salt, and this is still evident in the English language as the word salary derives from the Latin word salarium that means payment in salt (Latin sal), as well as the phrase "worth one's salt". It was also of high value to the Hebrews, Greeks and other peoples of antiquity. During the late Roman Empire and throughout the Middle Ages salt was a precious commodity carried along the salt roads into the heartland of the Germanic tribes. Cities, states and dukedoms along the salt roads exacted heavy duties and taxes for the salt passing through their territories. This practice caused wars, it even caused the formation of cities such as the city of Munich in 1158 when the then Duke of Bavaria Henry XII, called The Lion, decided that the bishops of Freising no longer needed their salt revenue. - Wikipedia
TEXT.German: [TAB]Salz zählt von altersher und überall in der Welt zu den begehrtesten Gewürzen. Viele traditionelle Fleisch- und Milchspeisen können ohne Salz nicht zubereitet werden. In Südamerika wurde Salz häufig durch das Auswaschen, Filtern und Einkochen salziger Erde gewonnen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il sale e anzitutto un esaltatore di sapidita usato in tutte le tradizioni culinarie conosciute ed e ampiamente sfruttato nell'industria conserviera sia come ingrediente che come mezzo di conservazione dei cibi. Quest'ultima proprieta e dovuta all'effetto disidratante che il sale ha sui materiali con cui viene a contatto, da cui estrae l'acqua per osmosi. Sale da cucina additivato di elementi particolari puo essere prescritto per curare o prevenire alcune malattie (ad esempio il sale iodato per il gozzo o addizionato di cloruro di potassio per l'ipertensione). Il sale e anche un reagente usato in chimica, ad esempio per migliorare la precipitazione dei prodotti al termine di una saponificazione. Un uso importante nell'industria chimica e come materia prima negli impianti cloro-soda, in cui viene eseguita l'elettrolisi della salamoia di cloruro di sodio per ottenere cloro gassoso, idrogeno e soda caustica, tutte materie prime fondamentali per l'industria chimica. TEXT.English: [TAB]Gold miners, silver miners and other prospectors arrived early on during the exploration of the Americas, the first gold miners coming with Columbus on his second voyage to the new world. After the tales of the fabulous wealth of the Aztecs and Incas, many early European expeditions contained gold miners, in the hopes that they too would find valuable deposits like the Spanish had. Gold miners continued to be drawn to the Americas with reports of every 'strike', such as that of the California gold rush of the mid 1800's. The gold miners helped to establish the numerous mining towns that sprang up, though most towns along with the miners quickly disappeared as soon as the gold dried up.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'or a toujours été l'un des métaux les plus recherchés au monde. Il est utilisé dans la fabrication de nombreux produits, allant des bijoux aux appareils électroniques. Il sert aussi de référence pour des systèmes monétaires internationaux. Ce qui donne sa valeur à l'or est sa rareté. Bien que l'on en trouve dans de nombreux endroits, les gisements les plus importants sont des veines de minerai d'or situées sous des massifs montagneux. Lorsqu'un gisement important est découvert, son exploitation stimule considérablement l'économie des villes environnantes. Ainsi, au XIXe siècle, la ruée vers l'or en Californie conduisit en peu de temps à la fondation de nombreuses villes prospères.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Gold und Silber zählen seit jeher zu den begehrtesten und wertvollsten Metallen der Welt. Die Verwendungszwecke reichen von der Schmuckfertigung bis hin zur Elektronik, und sogar das weltweite Währungssystem basiert auf diesem Edelmetall. Die Ursache für den hohen Wert von Gold oder Silber ist die Seltenheit. Zwar gibt es in vielen Regionen der Welt Goldvorkommen, allerdings sind die wertvollsten großen Goldadern tief im Inneren der Berge. Das Auffinden eines großen Vorkommens bedeutet für die Siedlungen und Städte in der Nähe der Mine einen bedeutenden wirtschaftlichen Aufschwung. Ein historisches Beispiel für dieses Phänomen sind die vielen Ortschaften, die während des kalifornischen Goldrauschs entstanden und eine kurze Blütezeit erlebten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'oro è da sempre uno dei metalli più preziosi del pianeta ed è stato utilizzato per realizzare qualsiasi oggetto, dai gioielli ai componenti elettronici, ponendo le basi per un sistema economico mondiale. L'oro è molto prezioso a causa della sua rarità. Sebbene sia possibile trovare oro in differenti zone del mondo, i giacimenti più ricchi sono all'interno delle montagne. Quando viene scoperto un grande giacimento, l'estrazione dell'oro migliora sensibilmente l'economia degli insediamenti e delle città circostanti. Nel 1800, molte città della California sono prosperate in breve tempo durante la corsa all'oro.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El oro siempre ha sido uno de los metales más valorados del mundo. Se usa en la fabricación de todo tipo de artículos, desde joyas a electrónica, y constituye la base del sistema monetario mundial. El factor que otorga al oro su valor es su rareza. Aunque se puede encontrar oro en muchas regiones distintas, los yacimientos más valiosos son grandes vetas de mineral de oro situadas en el interior de montañas. Cuando se encuentra un gran yacimiento, la explotación de la veta potencia enormemente la economía en las poblaciones y ciudades que están cerca de la mina. Un ejemplo histórico de este fenómeno son las numerosas ciudades que crecieron y prosperaron en poco tiempo durante la fiebre del oro de California en el siglo XIX.

TEXT.English: To make the most of a bountiful silver vein, gold vein or gemstone vein bring in an [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Expert Prospector[COLOR_REVERT]. Expert Prospectors are able to produce double the amount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silver[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gems[COLOR_REVERT] from tile!
TEXT.French: Pour exploiter au mieux une importante veine d'or, engagez un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mineur d'or professionnel[COLOR_REVERT]. Les Mineurs d'or professionnels sont capables d'extraire deux fois plus d'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Or[COLOR_REVERT] que la normale !
TEXT.German: Um eine Silberader, eine Goldader oder ein Edelsteinvorkommen optimal zu nutzen, sollten Sie einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Erfahrenen Schürfer[COLOR_REVERT] daran arbeiten lassen. Erfahrene Schürfer können doppelt so viel [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silber[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] oder [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Edelstein[COLOR_REVERT] von einem Geländefeld fördern!
TEXT.Italian: Per sfruttare al massimo una ricca vena d'oro, chiama un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]minatore d'oro esperto[COLOR_REVERT]. I minatori d'oro esperti sono in grado di raddoppiare la quantità di [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Oro[COLOR_REVERT] ottenuta dalla casella!
TEXT.Spanish: Para sacar el mejor partido de una vena de oro, llamad a un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Minero de oro experto[COLOR_REVERT]. Los Mineros de oro expertos son capaces de extraer el doble de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Oro[COLOR_REVERT] de una casilla en la que haya este metal.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Valuable Wood is very hard, which combined with its very high density (it is one of the woods that sink in water), fine texture, and ability to polish very smoothly, has made it very valuable as an ornamental wood. The species is still fairly widespread and frequent in the wild, though threatened by over-harvesting for its valuable wood; it is also extensively planted within its native range for wood production.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Valuable Wood is very hard, which combined with its very high density (it is one of the woods that sink in water), fine texture, and ability to polish very smoothly, has made it very valuable as an ornamental wood. The species is still fairly widespread and frequent in the wild, though threatened by over-harvesting for its valuable wood; it is also extensively planted within its native range for wood production.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Edelholz ist sehr hart, hat eine hohe dichte, feine Texturen und kann sehr glatt geschliffen werden. Dadurch ist es sehr begehrt um Verzierungen oder hochwertige Holzprodukte, wie zum Beispiel Möbel herzustellen.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The cayenne pepper, also known as the Guinea spice, Cow Horn Pepper, aleva or bird pepper or, especially in its powdered form, red pepper, is a hot, red chili pepper used to flavor dishes and for medicinal purposes. Named for the city of Cayenne in French Guiana, it is a cultivar of Capsicum annuum related to bell peppers, jalapenos, and others. The Capsicum genus is in the nightshade family.
TEXT.French: [TAB]The cayenne pepper, also known as the Guinea spice, Cow Horn Pepper, aleva or bird pepper or, especially in its powdered form, red pepper, is a hot, red chili pepper used to flavor dishes and for medicinal purposes. Named for the city of Cayenne in French Guiana, it is a cultivar of Capsicum annuum related to bell peppers, jalapenos, and others. The Capsicum genus is in the nightshade family.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Cayenne-Pfeffer, auch bekannt als Guinea-Gewürze oder auch Roter Pfeffer, ist ein scharfer roter Chili Pfeffer, der genutzt wird um Gerichte zu verfeinern oder auch als Medizin Anwendung findet. Er zählt zu den Nachtschattengewächsen.

TEXT.Italian: [TAB]The cayenne pepper, also known as the Guinea spice, Cow Horn Pepper, aleva or bird pepper or, especially in its powdered form, red pepper, is a hot, red chili pepper used to flavor dishes and for medicinal purposes. Named for the city of Cayenne in French Guiana, it is a cultivar of Capsicum annuum related to bell peppers, jalapenos, and others. The Capsicum genus is in the nightshade family.

TEXT.English: [TAB][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT] is one of the oldest types of corn humanity knows. It is not as good for production of flour as for example wheat but very well suited for making [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [TAB][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barley[COLOR_REVERT] is one of the oldest types of corn humanity knows. It is not as good for production of flour as for example wheat but very well suited for making [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Beer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: [TAB][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gerste[COLOR_REVERT] ist eine der ältesten Getreidesorten, die die Menschheit kennt. Bezüglich des Stärkegehalts und der Mehlerzeugung ist es nicht so ergiebig, wie andere Getreidesorten, so zum Beispiel Weizen, aber es eignet sich hervorragend zur Herstellung von Bier.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Wine, a beverage made from fermented grapes, was first produced as early as 6000 BC. Its use spread throughout the Middle East and Egypt, and it quickly became a popular beverage of the ancient world. The grapes used for the making of wine are grown in many different regions of the world. Most vineyards are located in hills and valleys of temperate regions. Wine making as an industry has been perfected over several centuries. Many regions such as the Rhine and Loire valleys of Europe are well known for their fine wines, and derive a significant portion of their economy from wine making.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le vin est une boisson obtenue par la fermentation du raisin. Sa production débute dès 6 000 ans av. J.-C. Sa consommation se répand à travers tout le Moyen-Orient et l'Egypte, et il devient rapidement une boisson très populaire dans le monde antique. Le raisin utilisé dans la fabrication du vin est cultivé dans de nombreuses régions du monde. Les vignes sont généralement situées sur les coteaux et dans les vallées des régions tempérées. Les procédés de fabrication du vin ont été perfectionnés au cours des siècles. De nombreuses régions, comme les vallées du Rhin et de la Loire, sont réputées pour leurs bons vins, et une grande partie de leur économie est liée à la fabrication du vin.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der aus fermentierten Trauben hergestellte Wein wurde erstmals um 6000 vor Christus produziert und war im Nahen Osten und in Ägypten weit verbreitet. Das Getränk entwickelte sich schnell zu einem der beliebtesten kulinarischen Genüsse der Antike. Die für die Weinherstellung benötigten Trauben werden in vielen verschiedenen Gebieten der Welt angebaut, die meisten Weinhänge befinden sich jedoch in den Hügeln und Tälern von Regionen mit gemäßigtem Klima. Im Laufe mehrerer Jahrhunderte wurde die industrielle Weinherstellung immer weiter perfektioniert. Viele Anbaugebiete wie die Rhein- und Loiretäler in Europa sind für ihre feinen Weine bekannt und beziehen einen Großteil ihrer wirtschaftlichen Erträge aus der Weinproduktion.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Realizzato dalla fermentazione dell'uva, il primo vino risale circa al 6000 a. C. e si diffuse rapirdamente attraverso il Medio Oriente e l'Egitto, diventando una delle bevande più popolari del mondo antico. Le qualità d'uva usate per la realizzazione del vino crescono in differenti zone del mondo; la maggior parte delle vigne si possono trovare sulle colline e nelle vallate di regioni dal clima temperato. L'industria del vino è andata perfezionandosi nel corso dei secoli: molte regioni europee, come le vallate del Reno e della Loira, sono rinomate per la produzione di ottimi vini, principale forma di economia della zona.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El vino, una bebida preparada a partir de uvas fermentadas, se elaboró por vez primera ya en el 6000 a. C. Su consumo se extendió rápidamente por Oriente Medio y Egipto, y pronto se convirtió en una popular bebida en el mundo antiguo. Las uvas empleadas en la fabricación del vino crecen en muchas y muy distintas partes del mundo. La mayoría de las viñas están en colinas y valles de regiones templadas. La vinicultura se ha perfeccionado como industria a lo largo de varios siglos. Muchas regiones, como los valles del Rin y del Loira en Europa, son conocidas por sus grandes vinos y obtienen una parte significativa de sus ingresos de la vinicultura.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Grapes in North America were a part of many Native American Indian diets, but were considered by most Europeans as unsuitable for wine. Europeans repeatedly tried to transplant more familiar varieties of grape to the new world. Early in the 17th century, French vine growers were brought to the New World to teach colonists cultivate grapes.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Valuable Wood is very hard, which combined with its very high density (it is one of the woods that sink in water), fine texture, and ability to polish very smoothly, has made it very valuable as an ornamental wood. The species is still fairly widespread and frequent in the wild, though threatened by over-harvesting for its valuable wood; it is also extensively planted within its native range for wood production.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Valuable Wood is very hard, which combined with its very high density (it is one of the woods that sink in water), fine texture, and ability to polish very smoothly, has made it very valuable as an ornamental wood. The species is still fairly widespread and frequent in the wild, though threatened by over-harvesting for its valuable wood; it is also extensively planted within its native range for wood production.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Edelholz ist sehr hart, hat eine hohe dichte, feine Texturen und kann sehr glatt geschliffen werden. Dadurch ist es sehr begehrt um Verzierungen oder hochwertige Holzprodukte, wie zum Beispiel Möbel herzustellen.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Furniture makers during the colonial period were often little more than skilled carpenters with shops set up in rural villages. There they built and repaired goods needed primarily by farm families. Colonists who had money tended to import the majority of their furniture directly from Europe, as it was typically better made and was in vogue with the latest European styles. However, some colonial furniture makers did try to replicate such European styles.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Valuable Wood is very hard, which combined with its very high density (it is one of the woods that sink in water), fine texture, and ability to polish very smoothly, has made it very valuable as an ornamental wood. The species is still fairly widespread and frequent in the wild, though threatened by over-harvesting for its valuable wood; it is also extensively planted within its native range for wood production.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Edelholz ist sehr hart, hat eine hohe dichte, feine Texturen und kann sehr glatt geschliffen werden. Dadurch ist es sehr begehrt um Verzierungen oder hochwertige Holzprodukte, wie zum Beispiel Möbel herzustellen.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The cayenne pepper, also known as the Guinea spice, Cow Horn Pepper, aleva or bird pepper or, especially in its powdered form, red pepper, is a hot, red chili pepper used to flavor dishes and for medicinal purposes. Named for the city of Cayenne in French Guiana, it is a cultivar of Capsicum annuum related to bell peppers, jalapenos, and others. The Capsicum genus is in the nightshade family.

TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Cayenne-Pfeffer, auch bekannt als Guinea-Gewürze oder auch Roter Pfeffer, ist ein scharfer roter Chili Pfeffer, der genutzt wird um Gerichte zu verfeinern oder auch als Medizin Anwendung findet. Er zählt zu den Nachtschattengewächsen.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Beer is an alcoholic beverage produced by the saccharification of starch and fermentation of the resulting sugar. The starch and saccharification enzymes are often derived from malted cereal grains, most commonly malted barley and malted wheat. Most beer is also flavoured with hops, which add bitterness and act as a natural preservative, though other flavourings such as herbs or fruit may occasionally be included. The preparation of beer is called brewing. Beer is the world's most widely consumed alcoholic beverage. It is the third-most popular drink overall, after water and tea.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Beer is an alcoholic beverage produced by the saccharification of starch and fermentation of the resulting sugar. The starch and saccharification enzymes are often derived from malted cereal grains, most commonly malted barley and malted wheat. Most beer is also flavoured with hops, which add bitterness and act as a natural preservative, though other flavourings such as herbs or fruit may occasionally be included. The preparation of beer is called brewing. Beer is the world's most widely consumed alcoholic beverage. It is the third-most popular drink overall, after water and tea.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Bier ist ein alkohol- und kohlensäurehaltiges Getränk, das durch Gärung meist aus den Grundzutaten Wasser, Malz und Hopfen gewonnen wird. Malz wiederum ist getrocknetes und gekeimtes Getreide, meist Gerste. Bier ist schon seit tausenden Jahren bekannt.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Brewers typically produced beer for colonists. The Puritans on the Mayflower brought over with them more beer than water. Experience in Europe had taught them that drinking beer was safer than drinking water which could often be polluted with sewage or garbage. Alcohol was also an found to be an effective analgesic, which helped to not only provide the energy necessary for hard work, but also generally enhanced the quality of life.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Brewing is the production of beer through steeping a starch source (commonly cereal grains) in water and then fermenting with yeast. Brewing has taken place since around the 6th millennium BC, and archaeological evidence suggests that this technique was used in ancient Egypt. Brewers typically produced beer for colonists. The Puritans on the Mayflower brought over with them more beer than water. Experience in Europe had taught them that drinking beer was safer than drinking water which could often be polluted with sewage or garbage. Alcohol was also an found to be an effective analgesic, which helped to not only provide the energy necessary for hard work, but also generally enhanced the quality of life.

TEXT.French: [TAB]Beer is an alcoholic beverage produced by the saccharification of starch and fermentation of the resulting sugar. The starch and saccharification enzymes are often derived from malted cereal grains, most commonly malted barley and malted wheat. Most beer is also flavoured with hops, which add bitterness and act as a natural preservative, though other flavourings such as herbs or fruit may occasionally be included. The preparation of beer is called brewing. Beer is the world's most widely consumed alcoholic beverage. It is the third-most popular drink overall, after water and tea.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Bier ist ein alkohol- und kohlensäurehaltiges Getränk, das durch Gärung meist aus den Grundzutaten Wasser, Malz und Hopfen gewonnen wird. Malz wiederum ist getrocknetes und gekeimtes Getreide, meist Gerste. Bier ist schon seit tausenden Jahren bekannt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Beer is an alcoholic beverage produced by the saccharification of starch and fermentation of the resulting sugar. The starch and saccharification enzymes are often derived from malted cereal grains, most commonly malted barley and malted wheat. Most beer is also flavoured with hops, which add bitterness and act as a natural preservative, though other flavourings such as herbs or fruit may occasionally be included. The preparation of beer is called brewing. Beer is the world's most widely consumed alcoholic beverage. It is the third-most popular drink overall, after water and tea.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Beer is an alcoholic beverage produced by the saccharification of starch and fermentation of the resulting sugar. The starch and saccharification enzymes are often derived from malted cereal grains, most commonly malted barley and malted wheat. Most beer is also flavoured with hops, which add bitterness and act as a natural preservative, though other flavourings such as herbs or fruit may occasionally be included. The preparation of beer is called brewing. Beer is the world's most widely consumed alcoholic beverage. It is the third-most popular drink overall, after water and tea.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Wine, a beverage made from fermented grapes, was first produced as early as 6000 BC. Its use spread throughout the Middle East and Egypt, and it quickly became a popular beverage of the ancient world. The grapes used for the making of wine are grown in many different regions of the world. Most vineyards are located in hills and valleys of temperate regions. Wine making as an industry has been perfected over several centuries. Many regions such as the Rhine and Loire valleys of Europe are well known for their fine wines, and derive a significant portion of their economy from wine making.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le vin est une boisson obtenue par la fermentation du raisin. Sa production débute dès 6 000 ans av. J.-C. Sa consommation se répand à travers tout le Moyen-Orient et l'Egypte, et il devient rapidement une boisson très populaire dans le monde antique. Le raisin utilisé dans la fabrication du vin est cultivé dans de nombreuses régions du monde. Les vignes sont généralement situées sur les coteaux et dans les vallées des régions tempérées. Les procédés de fabrication du vin ont été perfectionnés au cours des siècles. De nombreuses régions, comme les vallées du Rhin et de la Loire, sont réputées pour leurs bons vins, et une grande partie de leur économie est liée à la fabrication du vin.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der aus fermentierten Trauben hergestellte Wein wurde erstmals um 6000 vor Christus produziert und war im Nahen Osten und in Ägypten weit verbreitet. Das Getränk entwickelte sich schnell zu einem der beliebtesten kulinarischen Genüsse der Antike. Die für die Weinherstellung benötigten Trauben werden in vielen verschiedenen Gebieten der Welt angebaut, die meisten Weinhänge befinden sich jedoch in den Hügeln und Tälern von Regionen mit gemäßigtem Klima. Im Laufe mehrerer Jahrhunderte wurde die industrielle Weinherstellung immer weiter perfektioniert. Viele Anbaugebiete wie die Rhein- und Loiretäler in Europa sind für ihre feinen Weine bekannt und beziehen einen Großteil ihrer wirtschaftlichen Erträge aus der Weinproduktion.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Realizzato dalla fermentazione dell'uva, il primo vino risale circa al 6000 a. C. e si diffuse rapirdamente attraverso il Medio Oriente e l'Egitto, diventando una delle bevande più popolari del mondo antico. Le qualità d'uva usate per la realizzazione del vino crescono in differenti zone del mondo; la maggior parte delle vigne si possono trovare sulle colline e nelle vallate di regioni dal clima temperato. L'industria del vino è andata perfezionandosi nel corso dei secoli: molte regioni europee, come le vallate del Reno e della Loira, sono rinomate per la produzione di ottimi vini, principale forma di economia della zona.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El vino, una bebida preparada a partir de uvas fermentadas, se elaboró por vez primera ya en el 6000 a. C. Su consumo se extendió rápidamente por Oriente Medio y Egipto, y pronto se convirtió en una popular bebida en el mundo antiguo. Las uvas empleadas en la fabricación del vino crecen en muchas y muy distintas partes del mundo. La mayoría de las viñas están en colinas y valles de regiones templadas. La vinicultura se ha perfeccionado como industria a lo largo de varios siglos. Muchas regiones, como los valles del Rin y del Loira en Europa, son conocidas por sus grandes vinos y obtienen una parte significativa de sus ingresos de la vinicultura.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Winemakers in the colonies, learned to make a wide variety of differing wines from fruits due to the native varieties being unsuitable to European tastes. They additionally made wine from such products as flowers, herbs, and oak leaves.

TEXT.English: [TAB][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Taverns[COLOR_REVERT] soon evolved in all cities of the colonies, especially in the harbour areas. There the inhabitants of the cities but especially sailors from the trading ships found entertainment in form of alcohol, music and many other things.
TEXT.French: [TAB][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Taverns[COLOR_REVERT] soon evolved in all cities of the colonies, especially in the harbour areas. There the inhabitants of the cities but especially sailors from the trading ships found entertainment in form of alcohol, music and many other things.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In den Hafenstädten der Neuen Welt entstanden sehr schnell unzählige [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tavernen[COLOR_REVERT], in denen die Bewohner der Städte und vorallem auch die Seeleute der vielen Handelsschiffe Unterhaltung in Form von Alkohol, Musik und vielem mehr fanden. In manchen dieser Tavernen, vorallem in den berüchtigten Hafengegenden, ging es sehr rau her und sie waren Anziehungspunkt für Gesindel und zwielichtige Gestalten aller Art.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Taverns[COLOR_REVERT] soon evolved in all cities of the colonies, especially in the harbour areas. There the inhabitants of the cities but especially sailors from the trading ships found entertainment in form of alcohol, music and many other things.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB][COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Taverns[COLOR_REVERT] soon evolved in all cities of the colonies, especially in the harbour areas. There the inhabitants of the cities but especially sailors from the trading ships found entertainment in form of alcohol, music and many other things.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Leather has been one of the most important goods in human history. Usually procuced from Hides of Cattle it is mostly used for production of clothes.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Leather has been one of the most important goods in human history. Usually procuced from Hides of Cattle it is mostly used for production of clothes.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Leder war in der menschlichen Geschichte eines der wichtigsten Materialien. Meist aus Rinderhäuten hergestellt diente Leder verschiedensten Zwecken, meist jedoch der Herstellung von Kleidung. Ledergerber war zwar einer der am weningsten angesehenen Berufe oder Stände, aber essentiell für jede damalige Gesellschaft. Auch in der neuen Welt spielte die Herstellung von Leder eine bedeutende Rolle.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Leather has been one of the most important goods in human history. Usually procuced from Hides of Cattle it is mostly used for production of clothes.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Leather has been one of the most important goods in human history. Usually procuced from Hides of Cattle it is mostly used for production of clothes.

TEXT.English: To make the most of a bountiful gold vein, bring in an [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Expert Prospector[COLOR_REVERT]. Expert Prospectors are able to produce double the amount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] from a gold-producing tile!
TEXT.French: Pour exploiter au mieux une importante veine d'or, engagez un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mineur d'or professionnel[COLOR_REVERT]. Les Mineurs d'or professionnels sont capables d'extraire deux fois plus d'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Or[COLOR_REVERT] que la normale !
TEXT.German: Um eine Goldader optimal zu nutzen, sollten Sie einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Erfahrenen Schürfer[COLOR_REVERT] daran arbeiten lassen. Erfahrene Goldminenarbeiter können doppelt so viel [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] von einem Gold produzierenden Geländefeld fördern!
TEXT.Italian: Per sfruttare al massimo una ricca vena d'oro, chiama un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]minatore d'oro esperto[COLOR_REVERT]. I minatori d'oro esperti sono in grado di raddoppiare la quantità di [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Oro[COLOR_REVERT] ottenuta dalla casella!
TEXT.Spanish: Para sacar el mejor partido de una vena de oro, llamad a un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Minero de oro experto[COLOR_REVERT]. Los Mineros de oro expertos son capaces de extraer el doble de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Oro[COLOR_REVERT] de una casilla en la que haya este metal.

TEXT.English: Gold Miners do one thing only: make profit. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gold[COLOR_REVERT], which cannot be processed into anything else, can immediately be sold at a high price. Assigning an [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Expert Prospector[COLOR_REVERT] to this job will yield an increased amount of the shiny stuff!
TEXT.French: Les mineurs d'or ne font qu'une chose : réaliser des profits. L'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]or[COLOR_REVERT], qui ne peut être transformé en quoi que ce soit d'autre, peut être immédiatement vendu au prix fort. En assignant un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mineur d'or professionnel[COLOR_REVERT] à cette profession, vous augmenterez votre production ce précieux métal !
TEXT.German: Goldminenarbeiter tun nur eins: Sie erhöhen Ihren Profit. [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] kann nicht weiterverarbeitet werden, erzielt aber beim Verkauf einen hohen Preis. Wenn Sie diesem Beruf einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Erfahrenen Schürfer[COLOR_REVERT] zuweisen, erhalten Sie sogar noch mehr von dem glänzenden Zeug!
TEXT.Italian: I minatori d'oro producono solo una cosa: ricchezza. L'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]oro[COLOR_REVERT], che non può essere trasformato in altro, può essere immediatamente rivenduto a caro prezzo. Assegnando un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]minatore d'oro esperto[COLOR_REVERT] a questa professione otterrai una maggiore quantità di questo brillante minerale!
TEXT.Spanish: Los Mineros de oro solo sirven para una cosa: generar beneficios. Como la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]oro[COLOR_REVERT] no puede convertirse en algo más, se puede vender de inmediato a un buen precio. Asignar a un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Minero de oro experto[COLOR_REVERT] a este puesto generará un montón del preciado metal.

TEXT.English: To make the most of a bountiful gold vein, bring in an [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Expert Prospector[COLOR_REVERT]. Expert Prospectors are able to produce double the amount of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] from a gold-producing tile!
TEXT.French: Pour exploiter au mieux une importante veine d'or, engagez un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mineur d'or professionnel[COLOR_REVERT]. Les Mineurs d'or professionnels sont capables d'extraire deux fois plus d'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Or[COLOR_REVERT] que la normale !
TEXT.German: Um ein Edelsteinvorkommen optimal zu nutzen, sollten Sie einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Erfahrenen Schürfer[COLOR_REVERT] daran arbeiten lassen. Erfahrene Schürfer können doppelt so viel [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Edelstein[COLOR_REVERT] von einem Geländefeld fördern!

Assigning an [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Expert Prospector[COLOR_REVERT] to this job will yield an increased amount of the shiny stuff!

L'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]or[COLOR_REVERT], qui ne peut être transformé en quoi que ce soit d'autre, peut être immédiatement vendu au prix fort. En assignant un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mineur d'or professionnel[COLOR_REVERT] à cette profession, vous augmenterez votre production ce précieux métal !

Wenn Sie diesem Beruf einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Erfahrenen Schürfer[COLOR_REVERT] zuweisen, erhalten Sie sogar noch mehr von dem glänzenden Zeug!

L'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]oro[COLOR_REVERT], che non può essere trasformato in altro, può essere immediatamente rivenduto a caro prezzo. Assegnando un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]minatore d'oro esperto[COLOR_REVERT] a questa professione otterrai una maggiore quantità di questo brillante minerale!
